thread.title: U.S., China Edge Toward Trade Resolution

author: Lingling Wei
title: U.S., China Edge Toward Trade Resolution
text:
The U.S. and China are moving closer toward resolving their trade dispute, with the two sides agreeing on the broad outlines of a reprieve for embattled Chinese telecom giant ZTE Corp. and Beijing easing tariffs on imported cars.
The two sides had declared a truce this weekend, accompanied by a pledge from China to buy more U.S. farm products, energy and services.
For... RELATED VIDEO Why Trump’s ZTE U-Turn Has Sparked Backlash President Trump’s mixed messages about a plan to help controversial Chinese telecom giant ZTE has baffled Washington. WSJ's Shelby Holliday breaks down three reasons why lawmakers see the company as a threat. Illustration: Adam Falk
